snippet: Amid worries that the revolutions in the Middle East may set back women’s rights, Jordan’s queen urged that it is too soon to give up.
abstract: Queen Noor of Jordan, responding to worries that Arab Spring may give way to political Islam and set back cause of women’s rights, says it is too soon to give up hope that revolutions in region would ultimately yield social progress; remarks are made at Trust Women conference in London.
lead_paragraph: Amid worries that the revolutions in the Middle East may set back women’s rights, Jordan’s queen urged that it is too soon to give up.

headline.seo: Queen Noor Urges Faith in Revolutions
headline.main: Queen Noor Expresses Hope on the Rights of Arab Women
headline.print_headline: A Queen Expresses Hope on the Rights of Arab Women

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
